{{TOC|right}}

An enchantment [[Tag (Java Edition)|tag]] is a group of [[enchantment definition|enchantments]]. Enchantment tags are used in [[loot tables]], to configure exclusive enchantments, and other gameplay features.

== List of tags ==
=== curse ===
These enchantments have red colored description and cannot be removed with a grindstone.

{{tag_list|curse|type=enchantment
|binding_curse
|vanishing_curse
}}

=== double_trade_price ===
These enchantments get charged twice as much in villager trades.

{{tag_list|double_trade_price|type=enchantment
|#treasure
}}

=== in_enchanting_table ===
These enchantments can be obtained from Enchanting Table.

{{tag_list|in_enchanting_table|type=enchantment
|#non_treasure
}}

=== on_mob_spawn_equipment ===
These enchantments can be found on spawned mobs' equipment.

{{tag_list|on_mob_spawn_equipment|type=enchantment
|#non_treasure
}}

=== on_random_loot ===
These enchantments can be found on naturally generated equipment from loot tables.

{{tag_list|on_random_loot|type=enchantment
|#non_treasure
|binding_curse
|vanishing_curse
|frost_walker
|mending
}}

=== on_traded_equipment ===
These enchantments can be found on equipment sold by villagers.

{{tag_list|on_traded_equipment|type=enchantment
|#non_treasure
}}

=== prevents_bee_spawns_when_mining ===
Used to prevent bees from coming out when mining Bee Nest or Beehive.

{{tag_list|prevents_bee_spawns_when_mining|type=enchantment
|silk_touch
}}

=== prevents_decorated_pot_shattering ===
Used to prevent decorated pots from dropping bricks and sherds when broken with a tool.

{{tag_list|prevents_decorated_pot_shattering|type=enchantment
|silk_touch
}}

=== prevents_ice_melting ===
Used to prevent Ice turning into water instead of dropping itself when broken.

{{tag_list|prevents_ice_melting|type=enchantment
|silk_touch
}}

=== prevents_infested_spawns ===
Used to prevent infested blocks from spawning silverfish when broken.

{{tag_list|prevents_infested_spawns|type=enchantment
|silk_touch
}}

=== smelts_loot ===
Used in entity loot tables as a condition for the {{cd|minecraft:furnace_smelt}} function.

{{tag_list|smelts_loot|type=enchantment
|fire_aspect
}}

|blast_protection

|projectile_protection
}}

=== trades/desert_common ===
These enchantments can be sold by desert villagers from Novice to Expert levels.

{{tag_list|trades/desert_common|until=je 26.1|Experimental=Villager Trade Rebalance|type=enchantment
|fire_protection
|thorns
|infinity
}}
